Author: Mylo#8306
Content: if you start komodod with -gen from the command line, it will mine (pointless on a single server) whilst it syncs and doing so makes the sync take a looooooooong time.  so when syncing don't put `-gen -genproclimit`

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: if that's what you were doing

Author: k50#7856
Content:
Hi may I please ask regarding komodod for creating the Komodo Assetchain.
Say we have two hypothetical nodes up already:
1.2.3.4 (first)
1.2.3.5 (second)

and we now want to connect a third node do we connect to the first one only:
$ ./komodod [stuff_ommitted] -addnode=1.2.3.4 -gen &

or do we connect to all existing nodes:
$ ./komodod [stuff_ommitted] -addnode=1.2.3.4 -addnode=1.2.3.5 -gen &

Thanks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It wont matter... as long as the port is open to the interent on both nodes it will "find" any chains connected to any other chain from the one `addnode` parameter. It will just find them faster if you specify them all on the start command.

Author: k50#7856
Content: Thank you very much @blackjok3r.  Regarding the Komodo key value system, I think it is possible to use it as a NoSQL database with JSON like syntax. The problem I'm thinking is anyone with the key can see  it's value. I know there's a passphrase but that's for allowing updates to the user who created the key value data. Is there built in functionality to encrypt the value data? If not I think we just encrypt the data before storing it on the AssetChain. Please let me know my errors in logic. Thank you.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes as far as I am aware, you need to encrypt the data yourself before submitting.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Not a lof of experience with that though unfortunately.

Author: k50#7856
Content: Thanks again @blackjok3r! Is there a limit on the size of the value store? I can't seem to find information on the size limit.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: For that you would need to ask @Alright I think. He is currently sleeping, but feel free to drop him a PM, he should get back to you sometime later.

Author: k50#7856
Content: Ok thank you. Is it possible to setup a test dICO first (by creating a test AssetChain that has no value) so we know all the things we need to prepare in advance?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I cant see why not, but you would be better off talking to #chainmakers  or #chainzilla  about that kinds of stuff.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I can do it, but I have too many things on already lol.
